answers.answer: The lack of access to clean water and poor living conditions contribute to the rapid spread of infectious diseases among both children and adults, putting them at risk. These diseases include measles, rubella, polio, diphtheria, Hib, tuberculosis, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, and mumps.
answers.bResponse: The lack of access to clean water and poor living conditions contribute to the rapid spread of infectious diseases among both children and adults, putting them at risk. These diseases include measles, rubella, polio, diphtheria, Hib, tuberculosis, pertussis, tetanus, hepatitis B, and mumps. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/vaccination

answers.answer: It is crucial for parents to get their children vaccinated because large crowds, lack of access to clean water, and poor living conditions contribute to the rapid spread of infectious diseases among both children and adults. Unvaccinated or partially vaccinated children are at risk of contracting these diseases which could put them at serious health risks. Vaccinations help protect individuals against several deadly diseases such as measles, rubella, polio, diphtheria, Hib, tuberculosis, pertussis, tetanus, Hepatitis B, and mumps. By getting their children vaccinated, parents ensure that they receive the necessary protection against these potentially fatal illnesses.

answers.answer: In case your child has missed any scheduled vaccines or doesn't have them at all due to the current situation in Ukraine, it's essential to make up for the vaccine schedule as soon as possible. This includes contacting your local County Department for Public Health or other healthcare providers offering free vaccinations. In addition, if there are additional vaccines available outside the national Ukrainian vaccination program (e.g., rotavirus, pneumococcal infections, influenza), ensure they are administered promptly.

answers.answer: Yes, if you have access to vaccines that are not included in the national vaccination calendar of Ukraine, you can give them to your child as soon as possible. However, it is important to make sure they do not interfere with any necessary vaccines on the Ukrainian schedule. Consult your local County Department for Public Health or healthcare provider for guidance and free vaccinations when needed.

answers.answer: It is important to get vaccinated because vaccines help protect individuals from various diseases, including COVID-19. Vaccines stimulate the immune system to recognize and fight off harmful pathogens before they cause illness. By being vaccinated, one can reduce their risk of contracting and spreading infectious diseases, which helps maintain public health and prevent outbreaks. Additionally, some vaccines provide long-lasting immunity, protecting individuals even if they encounter the same pathogen later in life.

answers.answer: Yes, it is possible for individuals to experience side effects after receiving a COVID-19 vaccine. Reactions such as fever or muscle aches may occur following vaccination, which is considered normal. However, these symptoms typically subside within 2-3 days after vaccination.

answers.answer: There could be various reasons why some children miss their scheduled vaccinations such as forgetfulness by parents or caregivers, lack of awareness about the importance of vaccination schedules, difficulties in accessing healthcare services due to geographical constraints, financial limitations, or other personal circumstances. It is essential to communicate effectively with healthcare providers to reschedule missed appointments and ensure that children receive appropriate vaccinations to maintain overall health and prevent outbreaks of potentially life-threatening illnesses.

answers.answer: No, chronic illnesses do not prevent a child from getting vaccinated. In fact, children with chronic illnesses have a higher risk of severe infections that can be protected against by vaccination.

answers.answer: Yes, there are risks associated with outbreaks of contagious diseases such as polio and rubella. These diseases can cause serious health complications or even death, especially among vulnerable populations. It is important to take preventive measures by ensuring that your child receives timely vaccinations to protect them against these illnesses.
